thread.title: Halftime Report: What I'm Watching Into the Close
thread.title_full: Halftime Report: What I'm Watching Into the Close

author: yahoo
title: Halftime Report: What I'm Watching Into the Close
text:
The "Halftime Report" traders delivered their trades for the second half of the day and tomorrow's big earnings.

Josh Brown: We get these up opens in the market because an economic report misses expectations and everyone gets excited about six more weeks of stimulus, but these things are rolling over. At the end of the day you have the Russell breaking down and not great breadth after the initial bounce. I think this is trend-less situation right now. To get excited is a bit premature. 
Stephen Weiss: Mattel reports after the bell. It's got a decent size short interest but they seem to be out of sync with the economy with toys and the economy. I'd be cautious on this one. It's got a huge yield but I don't know how long that yield can keep going. 
Jim Lebenthal: I'd like to see if Schlumberger has anything good to say. I'm looking ahead to next week when we'll see a lot of good value names report. 
Trader disclosure: On October 15, 2015 the following stocks and commodities mentioned or intended to be mentioned on CNBC's "Halftime Report" were owned by the "Halftime Report" traders: 

Josh Brown: Long AAPL, BABA, DE, DNKN, EBAY, FB, JMBA,NFLX, PYPL, SAM, SHAK, SPWR, TWTR, XLE, XON. 
Stephen Weiss: Long AAL, C, CDK, CVC, CYBX, FB, GILD, LULU,NCR, THC, TWTR 
Jim Lebenthal: Long AAPL, BA, C, CSCO, DCO, EEQ, GAIA, GM, IBM, INTC, JCP, MPC, OA, ORBC, PFE,QCOM, SJT, SPLS, TGT, TIF, TRN, WGO. 
Stephanie Landsman Producer, CNBCâ€™s "Halftime Report" & "Fast Money" Related Securities Symbol Price   Change %Change MAT ---
